channel.title: Lagg problems
channel.description: Hey, while working on my server (testscape based, if that helps) I seem to have caused it to lag a lot, even when accessed solely by my computer, the same one running the server. I am not sure what may have triggered this, though lately I have been working on adding objects (It lags even when they are not used) and adding special attacks. Also, I know that this is not just my computer being slow because other servers that i have downloaded to test this problem with run fine. Does anyone know anything I can do to reduce this lag?

item.title: Lagg problems
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Gcommer:

I probably could give them their own class… but would that make It go faster? Because they are still being called at the same speed, and, if anything, wouldn’t they go even slower because they are in a whole separate class?

Yes, putting them in another class would break the lag down.

Read full topic

item.title: Lagg problems
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

It is. But I don’t recommend this site, due to the flame rate, you won’t learn as much as fast as you could.

Read full topic

item.title: Lagg problems
item.dc:creator: @Gcommer Gcommer
item.description:
@Gcommer wrote:

Aaah, ok, I am new to Java, but I do have a couple years of experience in other languages, so Java is proving fairly easy to pick up.

Read full topic

item.title: Lagg problems
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

If you remove them from client.java, and put it to its own .java, you will somewhat decrease the lag. The client.java being about 1000kb lags a bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Lagg problems
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Yes, but rewriting the methods for someone who is somewhat inexperienced could be a major problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Lagg problems
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Waffles!!:

Shorten them up. Do what I do, take something huge, and cut it down to a minimum

Gcommer:

Wow, I comment out the specials and it works great! I guess I’ll have to try and make the methods for the specials more efficient somehow…

Or, create a class that handles the specials.

Read full topic
